oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christmas services bulletin, 1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Japanese-inspired Christmas bulletin listing the service times for Catholic mass and Protestant services to be held for the 10th Marines, 2nd Marine Division in Kyushu, Japan, 1945. This bulletin was collected by American Marine, Melvin C. Dodson. Dodson served in the First and Second Marine Divisions during World War II. He was stationed in Pacific theater and saw action in the battle of Saipan and was stationed in Nagasaki. He also served in the Korean War. An excerpt from St. Luke, chapter two is printed inside the card. Greetings from both Protestant (Roger B. McShane) and Catholic (James W. Lutz) chaplains are included. Two carols are printed on the back: Silent Night and It Came Upon the Midnight Clear. Forms part of the Veterans History Project. 1 bulletin: col. ; 5.75 x 8 in.
